description:
I think this is the last app of it's kind that still support to place the application list at the top, something i need because my chat is on a vertical monitor.

It's not perfect, and i wish i could add grammalecte to it, but i use it daily and i love it very much.
I love the premise of the app and at the beginning it worked fine on my Fedora 40 machine. But recently it started to act up and crashes on startup.
summary: Worked like a charm but is completely broken now

description: Works great but only on X.Org. I have a hard time running electron apps on wayland, so the problem seems to originate from there.
This top of my list to install on any new pc.
Bacically its a fork of Ferdi/Franz. but much better. You can add attachments direct from your external drive.
Great way to centralize mails and chats.
summary: It will replace a lot of apps on my desktop

description: I like how customisable and easy to use it is, and that you don't have to log in to use it - very straightforward. Kudos to the developers!

The app itself is great, but i think there's missing in some point of feature like to implement of ad blocker to prevent some malicius event, pishing, malware, ads server tracking etc...

I Hope that maybe in near future, you will implement on the app itself.

Thanks alot for this beautifull app!
summary: suggestion to add some ad blocker

description:
Ubuntu 22.04, works pretty well. Services are endless and I was able to find everything I needed. 

Allows addition of custom websites as services too, in case you somehow end up without a service you need.

Encountered some minor bugs, had an issue swapping order of apps with drag and drop. Otherwise stable.

I generally really like everything this does. And it worked perfectly on the first run when I set everything up.
Then, after the second launch, I stopped getting notifications. It was annoying, but I put it aside, deciding I will fix it later.
Now, after like the 10th time, it simply won't start. It's completely broken.
summary: Started out good, completely broken now

description: Ferdium is not usable when you want to use it without an account. It tells the user that it can't connect to "no online services" when you want to store the accounts locally. Some people might think that this should be a bug report, but due to this bug reappearing all over different version it is a feature of the software.
Really nice tool, but unbareable to use as a flatpak application on wayland. Window keeps flickering and input is sometimes only delays visible.
summary: Really nice tool, but not as a flatpak on wayand

description: this app I used it always, is perfect for linux (I use steam deck)
Es la mejor que he encontrado para usar en Linux, me encanta.
Все соц-сети и мессенджеры в одном приложении - удобно.
summary: Все соц-сети и мессенджеры в одном приложении - удобно

description: Реально полезная программа которая совмещает в себе кучу сервисов, довольно удобно. Работает вроде бы хорошо, но шлифовка не помешает.
summary: Вот такую программу я и искал
